Kremlin — Soviet Tier X battleship.

A battleship project developed at the end of World War II (Project 24). She was the evolution of the Sovetsky Soyuz-class ships and was designed to counter American Iowa-class and Montana-class battleships.

b5da9e94f7c34aceacb4848ed73f1388

Player Opinion

Performance

As the peak of the Russian battleship line, Kremlin is a very durable battleship with noticeably worse-than-for-tier main battery dispersion at long ranges and better-than-for-tier main battery dispersion at close ranges. Much like her predecessors, players will find her accuracy much more favorable when closing in on the enemy.

While it seems natural that one should close the distance on the enemy to increase one's combat efficiency with this ship, the fact that all of the other same tier battleships have access to much longer ranges than Kremlin , including some cruisers such as Henri IV , makes forward advances difficult and risky. However, thanks to her unique Damage Control Party ( ), this makes forward advances much easier than with her peer battleships. But players should also note that there is only a limited number of the consumable available - running out of the consumable too quickly greatly decreases her survivability for the remainder of the battle.

In addition to her good survivability, Kremlin ’s anti-aircraft suite and armor are among the best for Tier X battleships, rivaling that of Montana ’s and Yamato ’s respectively. This makes aerial attacks not worthwhile for carriers and provides high immunity to critical hits from long range armor piercing shells. Furthermore, her somewhat poor maneuverability makes for much-needed planning ahead and good tactical positioning of the ship, as being caught broadside in close ranges would be very punishing compared to other same tier battleships.

Though Kremlin seems to have much higher combat efficiency for closer ranges than her peer battleships, this makes her relatively less efficient in battles where long range engagements are more favorable, as somewhat commonly seen today. She is a relatively difficult to play ship, requiring much-needed planning and good understanding of tactical positioning.

Pros:

  • Very well armoured
  • Short Damage Control Party ( ) cooldown - can quickly put out fires should she be set on fire shortly after putting one out
  • Good main battery dispersion at close ranges, fast turret traverse, and good firing angles
  • She has 18 inch main battery guns, allowing her to overmatch 30 mm plating
  • Good anti-aircraft suite
  • Decent concealment

Cons:

  • Short main battery firing range compared to other Tier X's and poor long range dispersion
  • Long main battery reload time
  • Large turning circle
  • Despite good armour, she has a very big citadel making showing the sides very dangerous
  • Lackluster secondaries
  • All of this adds up to a very constrained optimal fighting position

Research

Kremlin doesn't have any upgrades to research.

Optimal Configuration

Upgrades

The recommended upgrades for Kremlin are as follows:

  • Slot 1 : Main Armaments Modification 1 ( )
  • Slot 2 : Damage Control System Modification 1 ( )
  • Slot 3 : Aiming Systems Modification 1 ( )
  • Slot 4 : Steering Gears Modification 2 ( )
  • Slot 5 : Concealment System Modification 1 ( )
  • Slot 6 : Main Battery Modification 3 ( )

Commander Skills

Key skills for Kremlin commanders include Expert Marksman, Superintendent, and Concealment Expert.

Recommended Commander Skills

(points) 		Endurance Attack Support Versatility


1

Priority Target

Situational Awareness indicator will show the number of opponents currently aiming at you with main battery guns.

★★

Preventative Maintenance

-30% to the risk of incapacitation of main turrets, torpedo tubes, steering gear, engines.

★★

Expert Loader

-50% to reload time when shell type is switched.

★★

Air Supremacy

-5% aircraft restoration time.

Direction Center for Fighters

+1 fighter to carrier fighter squadrons or catapult fighters.

Improved Engine Boost

+10% Aircraft engine boost time.

Incoming Fire Alert

Indicator of long-range enemy artillery fire.

★

Last Gasp

Completely restores the engine boost for the last attack flight of the carrier's planes.



2

High Alert

-10% to reload time of Damage Control Party consumable.

★

Jack of All Trades

-5% to reload time of all consumables.

★★

Expert Marksman

+2.5 deg/sec to traverse speed of guns with a caliber up to 139mm.

+0.7 deg/sec to traverse speed of guns with a caliber above 139mm.

★★★

Torpedo Acceleration

+5 knots to torpedo speed.

-20% to torpedo range.

Smoke Screen Expert

+20% to the radius of the smoke screen.

Improved Engines

+2.5% Squadron speed.

Adrenaline Rush

-0.2% to reload times of all types of armament for each 1% of total health lost.

+0.2% squadron speed for each 1% of total health lost.

★★★

Last Stand

The ship remains able to move and maneuver while the engine or steering gears are incapacitated.



3

Basics of Survivability

-15% to time of repair, fire extinguishing, and recovery from flooding.

★★★

Survivability Expert

+350 ship HP for each ship tier.

+15 aircraft HP for each ship tier.

Torpedo Armament Expertise

-10% to reload time of torpedo tubes.

Aircraft Armor

Reduces continuous damage to aircraft in all AA defense zones.

-10% continuous damage.

Basic Firing Training

-10% to reload time of main battery guns with a caliber up to and including 139mm and all secondary battery guns.

+10% to continuous damage from AA guns.

★

Superintendent

+1 additional charge to all consumables mounted on a ship.

★★★

Demolition Expert

+2% chance of HE shells causing a fire on target.

+1% chance of rockets causing a fire on target.

+5% chance of HE bombs causing a fire on target.

Vigilance

+25% to detection range of enemy torpedoes.



4

Manual Fire Control for Secondary Armament

Tightens dispersion of shells from secondary batteries.

-15% for Tier I-VI ships.

-60% for Tier VII-X ships.

Manually selected target only.

★

Fire Prevention

-10% to the risk of fire.

The maximum number of fires on a ship is reduced to three.

★★★

Inertia Fuse for HE Shells

+30% to the armor penetration capacity of HE shells.

-1% chance of fire on target caused by shells <=139mm.

-3% chance of fire on target caused by shells >139mm.

Sight Stabilization

Speeds up the aiming of a carrier's aircraft.

+5% attack aircraft aiming speed.

+5% torpedo bomber aiming speed.

+10% dive bomber aiming speed.

Advanced Firing Training

+20% to firing range of main battery guns with a caliber up to 139mm and all secondary battery guns.

+15% damage/sec. within the explosion radius of shells fired from medium- and long-range AA defenses.

★★

Massive AA Fire

Instantaneous Damage +100%.

Priority AA sector preparation time +50%.

The priority sector does not increase the damage of AA mounts.

Radio Position Finding

Shows the direction to the nearest enemy ship.

The enemy is alerted that a bearing has been taken.

Concealment Expert

-10% to the detection radius of all ships and aircraft.

★★★

Key: ★★★ - Extremely Useful ★★ - Frequently Useful ★ - Occasionally Useful No stars - Not Useful

Consumables

Kremlin can equip the following consumables:

  • Slot 1: Damage Control Party ( )
  • Slot 2: Repair Party ( )

Camouflage

Type 1, 2, or 5 camouflage can be equipped for credits; Types 2 or 5 are recommended at a minimum to reduce the accuracy of incoming shells.

Players who wish to spend doubloons can equip Kremlin with Type 20 camouflage that lowers her detection radius, reduces the accuracy of incoming shells, reduces her repair costs, and increases the amount of experience she earns.

Signals

As with most battleships, players should focus on utilizing signals that maximize their survivability such as India Delta, Juliet Yankee Bissowtwo, and India Yankee

Recommended Signal Flags
